Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Domo Inc. (NASDAQ: DOMO) Sell-Side Analysis Report

## Company Overview
Domo, Inc. (DOMO) is a leading cloud-native data experience platform that enables organizations to ingest, process, analyze, and visualize data in real-time to drive business decisions. Founded in 2010 and headquartered in American Fork, Utah, Domo connects to hundreds of data sources, including cloud apps, databases, and APIs, powering a unified dashboard for executives, teams, and frontline workers. Its "magic ETL" (extract, transform, load) automates data preparation, while AI-driven insights via Domo AI and apps like Bios (pre-built industry solutions) accelerate value realization. Serving over 2,000 customers across industries like retail, finance, healthcare, and manufacturing, Domo emphasizes low-code/no-code tools for broad accessibility. As of its latest Q2 FY2025 earnings (ended July 31, 2024, reported September 5, 2024), Domo reported total revenue of $78.4 million (up 4% YoY), with subscription revenue at $73.7 million (up 5% YoY) and a reduced net loss of $25.3 million. The company targets mid-market and enterprise segments in the $100B+ cloud analytics market, focusing on operational efficiency and ROI through its "data never sleeps" real-time capabilities. Domo differentiates via its end-to-end platform (vs. fragmented tools), with 85%+ gross margins on subscriptions and a shift toward higher-ACV deals. (Word count: 218)

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 FY2025 Earnings (Sep 5, 2024)**: Revenue $78.4M (+4% YoY); Subscription revenue $73.7M (+5% YoY); Gross margin 75.8% (up from 74.5%); Non-GAAP operating loss $11.8M (improved from $17.5M); Cash flow from operations $6.4M (first positive in years); Ended quarter with $176.7M cash. Guidance: Q3 revenue $76-77M; FY2025 revenue $312-318M (+1-4% YoY).
- **Leadership Changes (Aug 2024)**: Appointed Julie Milne as Chief Revenue Officer to drive sales scaling.
- **Product Launches**: Domo AI Agent Studio (Jul 2024) for custom AI agents; Enhanced Bios for retail/media (Q2 2024).
- **Customer Wins**: Added Domino's Pizza as enterprise customer (announced Q2 2024 earnings).
- **Stock Performance**: Shares up ~20% post-Q2 earnings on positive cash flow signal; analyst upgrades from JMP Securities (Market Outperform, Sep 6, 2024).

## Growth Strategy
- **Land & Expand**: Focus on high-ACV deals (> $100K); Avg. ACV up 10% YoY to $42K (Q2 2024).
- **AI Integration**: Embed Domo AI across platform for predictive analytics, natural language querying.
- **Vertical Bios**: 20+ pre-built apps for industries (e.g., CPG, financial services) to speed deployment.
- **International Expansion**: EMEA/APAC growth via partnerships; 15% of revenue international.
- **Efficiency Focus**: Cut operating expenses 10% YoY; Aim for cash flow positivity and profitability by FY2026.

## Company and Sector Headwinds & Tailwinds

| Category | Headwinds | Tailwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | High churn (111% NRR in Q2 2024, below 120% target); Macro IT budget scrutiny; Competition from free incumbents (Power BI); Ongoing losses despite cash flow improvement. | First positive op. cash flow ($6.4M Q2); Reduced debt ($26M payoff Q2); Strong retention (98% gross); Enterprise momentum (40% YoY growth in >$100K ACV cohort). |
| **Sector (BI/Analytics)** | Economic slowdown delaying deals (Gartner: 5% BI market growth 2024); AI hype shifting budgets to hyperscalers; Data privacy regs (GDPR/CCPA). | Explosive AI/data demand (IDC: $140B market by 2028, 13% CAGR); Real-time analytics shift; Mid-market underserved by enterprise giants. |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Core Platform**: Data ingestion (500+ connectors), Magic ETL, Cards/Dashboards, Alerts.
- **Domo App Studio**: Low-code app builder.
- **Bios**: Industry-specific solutions (e.g., Retail Bios for inventory, Finance Bios for FP&A).
- **Embedded Analytics**: OEM integrations for SaaS partners.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Domo AI (Ongoing rollout, GA Jul 2024)**: AI agents, natural language generation, forecasting.
- **Agent Studio (Jul 2024)**: Build/deploy custom AI agents without coding.
- **Domo Everywhere (2024 focus)**: Enhanced embedded BI for partners.
- **R&D Pipeline**: Quantum computing integration trials (announced 2023, updates Q2 2024); Sustainability Bios (planned H2 2024).

## Market Share Approximations
- Global BI/Analytics market (~$30B in 2024, per Gartner).
- DOMO share: ~0.3-0.5% (est. based on $312M FY2025 rev guidance vs. market size; niche in cloud-native real-time BI).

## Forecast of Growth/Decline in Market Share
- **Short-term (2024-2025)**: Flat to +10% share gain via AI/Bios; Targeting 5-7% YoY revenue growth accelerating to 10%+.
- **Medium-term (2026+)**: +20-30% cumulative gain if NRR hits 115%+ and ACV scales; Risk of decline if churn persists amid Tableau/Power BI dominance (80%+ combined share).

## Comparison to Competitors
| Competitor | Market Share Est. | Key Diffs vs. DOMO | DOMO Edge |
|------------|-------------------|---------------------|-----------|
| **Salesforce Tableau** | 12-15% | Enterprise focus, viz-heavy; Acquired 2019. | DOMO's real-time + operational BI vs. Tableau's reporting. |
| **Microsoft Power BI** | 20-25% | Free tier, MS ecosystem; 30%+ YoY growth. | DOMO's no-code ETL/AI; Less vendor lock-in. |
| **Google Looker** | 5-7% | Semantic modeling; Cloud-native. | DOMO's broader connectors, lower cost for mid-market. |
| **ThoughtSpot/Sigma** | 1-2% each | Search-driven/AI analytics. | DOMO's end-to-end platform + apps ecosystem. |

## Partnerships
- **Tech**: AWS (preferred cloud), Snowflake, dbt, Google Cloud.
- **Resellers/Integrations**: Deloitte, PwC (consulting); Zapier, Workday.
- **Recent**: Expanded Snowflake partnership (Jun 2024) for data activation.

## M&A
- **Acquisitions**: None major since 2021 (Wouk Analytics). Focus on organic.
- **Rumors**: No active M&A talks; CEO indicated tuck-in buys possible for AI (Q2 call, Sep 2024).

## Current and Potential Major Clients
- **Current**: Domino's Pizza (new Q2 2024), Goodwill, Sony Music, Deckers Brands, Goodwill Industries (>10% of revenue from top 10 clients).
- **Potential**: Mid-market retailers/CPG (e.g., expanding from Noodles & Co.); Healthcare (e.g., like existing Banner Health).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **Customer Metrics**: 2,100+ customers; 422 with >$100K ACV (+40% YoY); NPS 50+.
- **ESG**: Strong diversity (40% women in leadership); Carbon-neutral ops since 2022.
- **Sentiment**: Positive online buzz post-earnings (StockTwits/Reddit: bullish on cash flow); Analyst consensus: Hold (avg. PT $11.60 from 7 analysts).

## Valuation and Recommendation
- **Current Stock Price** (as of Oct 7, 2024 close): $7.02 (Yahoo Finance/Google Finance).
- **Market Capitalization**: $278.4M (enterprise value ~$260M post-net cash).

| Metric | Value | Notes |
|--------|-------|-------|
| **P/S Ratio (TTM)** | 0.9x | Vs. sector 8x; Deep value. |
| **EV/Revenue FY2025E** | 0.8x | Guidance-based. |
| **Rule of 40** | 35 (growth + FCF margin) | Improving. |

- **Buy Rating**: 6/10 (Hold with upside potential). Positive cash flow inflection and AI momentum support growth, but high churn/macro risks cap enthusiasm for moderate-risk growth portfolio.
- **Estimated Fair Value**: $12.50/share (35% upside). Based on 2.5x FY2026E revenue ($360M est., 10% growth) at 20% discount to peers, assuming NRR improvement and 5% market share gain in sub-segment. Risks: Churn >110%, recession (downside to $5).
